item.title: Convex polyhedra collision test (GJK Algorithm)
item.description: If we interpret a polyhedron as a set of points, two polyhedra represented by sets \(A\) and \(B\), for example, collide if \(A \cap B \neq \emptyset\). The intersection set \(A \cap B\) represents all pairs of points between \(A\) and \(B\) which have distance \(0\) between them.
